get.summary: Get a list of PLP studies

PatientLevelPredictionAnalysis.description: Fully describes all dependencies required to execute a PLP analysis using the PatientLevelPrediction package (v2_0_5)

organizationName.description: The organization that produced the specification

packageName.description: The name of the R Package for execution

skeletonVersion.description: The cooresponding skelecton version to use

createdBy.description: The person who created the analysis

createdDate.description: The date and time the estimation was first saved

modifiedBy.description: The last person to modify the analysis

modifiedDate.description: The date and time the estimation was last saved

targetIds.description: A list of the cohort IDs from the cohortDefinition collectionfor use as targets in the prediction

outcomeIds.description: A list of the cohort IDs from the cohortDefinition collectionfor use as outcomes in the prediction

NaiveBayesSettings.description: Specification for a Naive Bayes model

RandomForestSettings.description: Specification for a Random Forest model

mtries.description: The number of features to include in each tree (-1 defaults to square root of total features)

ntrees.description: The number of trees to build

maxDepth.description: Maximum number of interactions - a large value will lead to slow model training

varImp.description: Perform an initial variable selection prior to fitting the model to select the useful variables

seed.description: An option to add a seed when training the final model

MLPSettings.description: Specification for a Multiayer Perception Model

seed.description: An option to add a seed when training the final model

KNNSettings.description: Specification for a K Nearest Neighbors Model

k.description: The number of neighbors to consider

GradientBoostingMachineSettings.description: Specification for a Gradient Boosting Machine Model

ntrees.description: The number of trees to build

nthread.description: The number of computer threads to (how many cores do you have?)

maxDepth.description: Maximum number of interactions - a large value will lead to slow model training

minRows.description: The minimum number of rows required at each end node of the tree

seed.description: An option to add a seed when training the final model

DecisionTreeSettings.description: Specification for a Decision Tree Model

maxDepth.description: The maximum depth of the tree

minSampleLeaf.description: The minimum number of samples per leaf

minImpurityDecrease.description: Threshold for early stopping in tree growth. A node will split if its impurity is above the threshold, otherwise it is a leaf.

seed.description: An option to add a seed when training the final model

plot.description: Boolean whether to plot the tree (requires python pydotplus module)

AdaBoostSettings.description: Specification for a Ada Boost Model

nEstimators.description: The maximum number of estimators at which boosting is terminated

learningRate.description: Learning rate shrinks the contribution of each classifier by learningRate. There is a trade-off between learningRate and nEstimators .

LassoLogisticRegressionSettings.description: Specification for a Lasso Logistic Regression Model

variance.description: A single value used as the starting value for the automatic lambda search

seed.description: An option to add a seed when training the model

GetDbPLPDataArgs.description: Create a parameter object for the function getPlpData

washoutPeriod.description: The mininum required continuous observation time prior to index date for a person to be included in the cohort. Note that this is typically done in the createStudyPopulation function,but can already be done here for efficiency reasons.

CreateStudyPopulationArgs.description: Create a parameter object for the function createStudyPopulation

binary.description: Forces the outcomeCount to be 0 or 1 (use for binary prediction problems)

includeAllOutcomes.description: (binary) indicating whether to include people with outcomes who are not observed for the whole at risk period

firstExposureOnly.description: Should only the first exposure per subject be included? Note thatthis is typically done in the createStudyPopulation function

washoutPeriod.description: The minimum required continuous observation time prior to index datefor a person to be included in the cohort.

removeSubjectsWithPriorOutcome.description: Remove subjects that have the outcome prior to the risk windowstart?

priorOutcomeLookback.description: How many days should we look back when identifying prior outcomes?

requireTimeAtRisk.description: Should subjects without time at risk be removed?

minTimeAtRisk.description: The miminum time at risk in days

riskWindowStart.description: The start of the risk window (in days) relative to the indexdate (+days of exposure if theaddExposureDaysToStart parameter isspecified).

addExposureDaysToStart.description: Add the length of exposure the start of the risk window?

riskWindowEnd.description: The end of the risk window (in days) relative to the index date (+days of exposure if the addExposureDaysToEnd parameter isspecified).

addExposureDaysToEnd.description: Add the length of exposure the risk window?

minCovariateFraction.description: The minimum fraction of target population who must have a covariate for it to be included in the model training

normalizeData.description: Whether to normalise the covariates before training

testSplit.description: Either 'person' or 'time' specifying the type of evaluation used. 'time' find the date where testFraction of patients had an index after the date and assigns patients with an index prior to this date into the training set and post the date into the test set 'person' splits the data into test (1-testFraction of the data) and train (validationFraction of the data) sets.  The split is stratified by the class label.

testFraction.description: The fraction of the data to be used as the test set in the patient split evaluation

splitSeed.description: The seed used to split the test/train set when using a person type testSplit

nfold.description: The number of folds used in the cross validation

ConceptSetCrossReference.description: Defines the relationship between a concept set and a target object

targetName.description: The target object name that will utilize the concept set

targetIndex.description: The index of the target object

propertyName.description: The property that will hold the list of concept IDs from the resolved concept set
